problem.markdown:
1. pH is a measurement of the activity of -----------ions in the sample. (x) Hydrogen ion () Carbon ion () Oxygen ion
2) In pH measurement Optimum measurement accuracy depends on () Solution concentration (x) Salt bridge and Measuring electrode () Probe Length
3) Electrolytes are substances containing (x) ions () cations () anions
4) Electrical conductivity is a measure of the ability of a solution to carry a -----------. (x) Current () Resistance () Inductance
5) In conductivity measurement -------migrate to the negative electrode, the ------ to the positive electrode. () Cations,Cations (x) Cations,Anions () Anions, Cations
6) The accuracy of conductivity measurements can be influenced by () Polarization () Contamination (x) Both, Polarization and Contamination
